text: question about fragments: is onPostResume() called after onRequestPermissionsResult() like it is called after onActivityResult() in an activity?

So we have this very peculiar issue on our app wherein the gcm token for a few users is being set as a normal English word like 'Message'.  This seems to be generated by GCM since the users did receive notification using that gcm token. We can also see that the notification was Delivered successfully to the user since we send a delivered status to our backend once a notification is received from GCM. This seems quite odd that GCM would generate such a token.

I just found out that Arrays.asList() returns a List who’s .add() doesn’t work. So the List interface allows you to do this via UnsupportedOperationException. Are there any other well known interfaces that do this?
what are you passing into asList?
nvm it only takes an array
yeah an array.
It’s great because asList() is really efficient in that it doesn’t actually go through making and allocating memory for a new list obj
but it’s at the expense of basically violating the contract
yep it is totally immutable
<http://stackoverflow.com/a/11659198/3238938>
